intro: Lobelia hillebrandii, commonly known as the Hillebrand's lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. It has opposite, narrow leaves and produces showy blooms during the spring and early summer. Lobelia hillebrandii is often found in association with other wetland plants and is an important component of its native ecosystem.
